availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry J. Clark (Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Clark and Tabitha Clark. Married to Emma R. Clark. Father of Martha E. Clark. Farmer in Jackson County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from August 24, 1861 to July 20, 1862. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Corporal from July 20, 1862 to January 18, 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Sergeant from January 18, 1863 to February 1, 1864. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from February 1, 1864 to October 5, 1864.
